name: overuse
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to use something too often or too much: I tend to overuse certain favourite expressions. An over-used tendon can become swollen and painful. Opposite
underuse
More examplesFewer examplesSome medications are overused.Sometimes we overuse and strain our muscles.The phrase has been so over-used as to be almost meaningless.

the fact that something is used too often or too much: The overuse of X-rays may be causing 250 deaths each year. Dry hair can be caused by the over-use of hairdryers and straighteners. Opposite
underuse
More examplesFewer examplesMost causes of joint pain are simply the result of overuse.Overuse of antibiotics can create mutated bacteria that are immune to the drugs.There were fears about traffic problems in the area and the over-use of the site.

/ˌoʊ·vərˈjus/
You can strain your muscles from sudden twisting or overuse.
